sentences.sContent: She provided emotional support at a very distressing time for me.
sentences.sCn: 在我非常痛苦的时候，她是我的情感支柱。

sentences.sContent: Ann suffered from depression and a number of other emotional problems.
sentences.sCn: 安患了抑郁症，还遇到一些其他的情绪问题。

sentences.sContent: the physical and emotional state of the patient
sentences.sCn: 患者的生理和情绪状态

sentences.sContent: The funeral was a very emotional experience for all of us.
sentences.sCn: 那次葬礼对我们大家来说都是一次无比伤感的经历。

sentences.sContent: He became very emotional when we had to leave.
sentences.sCn: 当我们不得不离开时，他非常伤感。

sentences.sContent: ...when we see another in emotional distress...
...This suggests to language scientists that emotional crying evolved before language...
...A plate of cut-up vegetables just doesn’t pack the same emotional a cupcake and not an apple as an after-school treat today...
...His great achievement was to combine an emotional spark with computer technology...
...Boys at single-sex schools were said to be more likely to get involved in cultural and artistic activities that helped develop their emotional expressiveness...
...He criticized teachers for failing to recognize that boys are actually more emotional than girls...

synos.tran: 情绪的；易激动的；感动人的

phrases.pCn: 情绪智力；情商；情绪智商

words.tran: 感情的；情绪的；表现感情的
没有情感的；不露情感的
感情上；情绪上；令人激动地；情绪冲动地
感情主义；诉诸感情；主情主义

trans.tranCn: 情绪(上)的，情感(上)的；激起感情的； 敏感的；情绪激动的〔尤指哭泣〕
trans.tranOther: relating to your feelings or how you control them
